alert.note: Alert for Coryell; McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 11:17AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern McLennan and southeastern Coryell Counties through 1145 AM CST... At 1117 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Fort Gates, or 12 miles northeast of Fort Hood, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waco, Hewitt, Robinson, Woodway, McGregor, Crawford, Mother Neff State Park, Lake Waco, Oglesby, Whitson, Willow Grove, Leon Junction, Spring Valley, Mound, Flat and The Grove. This includes Interstate 35 near mile marker 327. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
